moves.1. d4 Nf6 2. Nf3 d5 3. c4 e6 4. Nc3 Be7: A rare, but tricky move. I wasn't familiar with this line, and responded not that well

moves.9. Bxe7 Qxe7 10. Nxe4 dxe4 11. Qxe4: An important moment. Black has less space and certain problems with the c8-bishop. White is threatening to launch an attack right away, so I should have chosen a good way of defending

moves.22... Kg8 23. Qh7+ Kf8 24. Bxe6: I resigned, as the f-pawn cannot recapture without hanging the queen on c7, and opening the e-file will allow white to play a devastating Qh8.
